businessSummary.oneLiner: AI data analytics platform for government and enterprise - transitioning from core US defense/intel software partner to commercial AI powerhouse.
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since AIP (AI Platform) launch, its commercial segment has grown explosively. Q4 2025 revenue $1.407B (+70% YoY), US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). DHS $1B 5-year BPA, Rackspace partnership, and Mizuho Buy upgrade are positives, but SaaS-pocalypse fears and Burry criticism have pushed the stock down 24% in 2026.
howTheyMakeMoney: US Government: Data analytics platform for DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS - Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
US Commercial: Enterprise AI/data analytics - Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), fastest growing segment
International Government: NATO allies and international government contracts
International Commercial: Global enterprise customers (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers avg $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) - Enterprise AI integration platform, core growth engine
Gotham - Government/defense data analysis and decision-making platform
Foundry - Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo - Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN - US Army next-generation intelligence system

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely high valuation. PEG 2.3, firmly in overvalued territory

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on 2026 estimated earnings. Phillip Securities acknowledges high valuation but maintains Buy

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 10 consecutive quarters of acceleration. US commercial +137% YoY

keyMetrics.name: Debt Ratio
keyMetrics.interpretation: Cash + short-term treasuries $7.2B, zero debt. Current ratio 7.11

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA - No-bid procurement enabled
growthDrivers.description: DHS agencies (CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA) can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO grew from $2.6B to $4.2B.

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace Partnership Expansion - 250+ dedicated engineers
growthDrivers.description: Foundry and AIP running on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated Palantir engineering team expanding to 250+.

growthDrivers.title: US Commercial Revenue +137% explosive growth
growthDrivers.description: AIP-driven enterprise AI adoption accelerating. Top 20 customers avg $94M/year (+45% YoY). US commercial deal value +145% YoY.

growthDrivers.title: 'Category of One' - Multiple analyst upgrades
growthDrivers.description: Mizuho upgraded to Outperform, Phillip Securities maintains Buy. After forward multiple contraction, analysts call it a 'de-risked Category of One.'

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Dominant #1 in government/defense AI, rapidly building position in commercial AI with AIP. Irreplaceable in data security + AI integration.

moats.description: Highest-level security certifications for CIA, NSA, DHS. DHS BPA exempts competitive bidding. DISA IL5/IL6 certified.
More customers make AI models better, creating a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. Airbus multi-year contracts, DHS 5-year BPA.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Data cloud expanding AI capabilities, but weak in government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private, data lakehouse. Competes in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly behind in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by ex-Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction denied, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: 'Category of One' - Analysts upgrade after forward multiple contraction
recentNews.significance: Post-selloff valuation considered de-risked. Multiple analysts cite AIP growth momentum as basis for buy ratings.

recentNews.headline: Phillip Securities cuts PLTR target, reiterates Buy
recentNews.significance: Analyst Paul Chew lowered price target but maintained Buy rating. Acknowledges high valuation while focusing on growth momentum.

recentNews.headline: TipRanks: 'Palantir - AI Star or Bubble?' deep dive
recentNews.significance: Cites US commercial +137%, guidance $7.2B (+60%) as evidence of 'the operating system for government and enterprise AI.' Valuation premium debate.

recentNews.headline: Mizuho upgrades PLTR from Neutral to Outperform ($195)
recentNews.significance: Mizuho's Gregg Moskowitz says 'recent selloff unjustified, AIP is a Category of One.'

recentNews.headline: Percepta AI lawsuit - Non-compete injunction denied
recentNews.significance: Federal judge denied request to bar ex-employees from working at Percepta AI. Competitor free to operate, talent drain risk materialized.

recentNews.headline: DHS awards $1B 5-year BPA for AI platform deployment
recentNews.significance: DHS agencies can directly procure Palantir software. Single government contract adds $1B+ to backlog.

analystOpinions.notableComment: 20 analysts: Buy 9, Hold 10, Sell 1. Avg target $188 (+39%). Mizuho Outperform $195, Citi Strong Buy $260, BofA Buy $255, Phillip Securities Buy (target cut). Burry warns $50. Extreme polarization between 'Category of One' bulls and bubble bears.

risks.title: Extreme valuation - P/E 215x, down 24% in 2026
risks.description: P/E 215x, PEG 2.3 in overvalued territory. Forward P/S 45x. Burry flags Head & Shoulders pattern targeting $50.

risks.title: Percepta AI talent drain + non-compete injunction denied
risks.description: Three key ex-employees founded Percepta AI. Federal judge denied non-compete injunction. Structural moat erosion risk.

risks.title: SaaS-pocalypse - Fear that AI replaces SaaS
risks.description: Stock declined despite DHS, Rackspace, Mizuho catalysts, proving sentiment deterioration.

risks.title: Burry 'evil accounting' criticism - AR growth, CEO compensation
risks.description: AR grew faster than revenue in 9 of 12 quarters. CEO Karp's $17M private jet expenses.

risks.title: Government budget dependency and DOGE spending cut risk
risks.description: Government spending cuts could directly impact. Government revenue share remains significant.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + largest-ever pipeline
buyReasons.rationale: Major contracts in succession. 2026 guidance $7.18-7.20B (+60%), Q1 guidance $1.53-1.54B (crushing consensus $1.32B).

buyReasons.title: 35% off ATH + debt-free cash fortress $7.2B
buyReasons.rationale: Mizuho Buy $195, Citi $260. Consensus $188 implies +39% upside. RSI 40 approaching oversold.

buyReasons.title: Rule of 40 = 127% - Unprecedented growth+margin in software history
buyReasons.rationale: 70% growth + 57% adjusted margin. US commercial +137% YoY. 'Category of One' assessment.

overallOpinion: DHS $1B BPA, US commercial +137%, Rule of 40 = 127% prove real growth. 'Category of One' assessment
P/E 215x, SaaS-pocalypse, Burry attacks drove 24% decline in 2026. Below both 50-day and 200-day moving averages
Mizuho Buy $195 upgrade, Phillip Securities Buy maintained. 9 Buy vs 10 Hold - market still split
Percepta AI non-compete denial materializes talent drain risk. NVDA earnings (2/25) will set AI sector sentiment
RSI 40 near oversold, 35% discount from ATH - Q1 earnings will determine if SaaS-pocalypse selloff was overdone

sources.name: Yahoo Finance - 'Category of One' Upgrades
sources.description: De-risked valuation after forward multiple contraction, multiple analyst upgrades

sources.name: Yahoo Finance - Phillip Securities PLTR
sources.description: Phillip Securities target cut, Buy maintained

sources.name: TipRanks - PLTR AI Star or Bubble
sources.description: AIP growth+margin 'one of a kind' assessment, valuation debate

telegram.hook: Palantir 'Category of One' vs Burry's '$50' warning
telegram.text:

DHS $1B BPA - no-bid procurement enabled
US commercial +137% YoY, Rule of 40 = 127%
Mizuho Buy $195 upgrade, Phillip Securities Buy maintained
Cash $7.2B, zero debt, FCF margin 51%

P/E 215x - SaaS-pocalypse drove 24% YTD decline
Percepta AI non-compete injunction denied
Burry: Head & Shoulders pattern, $50 target

Consensus $188 (now $135, +39%) - Buy 9 / Hold 10
NVDA earnings 2/25 will set AI sector risk-on/off

Best growth+margin combo in software history, so why isn't the market buying?
